title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay with New England, declining OC interviews with other NFL teams.
Grant helped QB Drake Maye achieve a successful season, nearly winning NFL MVP and reaching Super Bowl LX.
Mike Vrabel and Josh McDaniels retain coaching roles in New England, maintaining continuity for QB Drake Maye.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Brighton's Matt's Barber Shop flooded after a burst pipe on February 10, 2026, causing extensive damage.
Customer Dietrich Warner initiated a GoFundMe, raising over $25,800 to support the barbershop's recovery.
A benefit show is scheduled for February 19 at O'Brien's Pub to further assist with the shop's restoration.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity' with Elizabeth Olsen and Miles Teller is now streaming on Apple TV.
'Dawson’s Creek' available on Netflix, Hulu, Tubi honors James Van Der Beek who passed away at 48.
'Love Is Blind' Season 10 released on Netflix, continues the show's unique dating format.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge ruled that two gender stereotype books are outside a father's legal battle over LGBTQ lessons.
The lawsuit by Alan L. targets issues of gender identity and sexuality, not books on gender stereotypes.
Judge Saylor noted Alan L. is likely to succeed in his claim regarding educational and religious upbringing rights.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony, at 21, could be the youngest player on Team USA for the World Baseball Classic.
Anthony replaces injured Corbin Carroll, pending a physical, after a strong MLB debut with Boston Red Sox.
Garrett Whitlock joins Anthony as the Red Sox representatives on Team USA; World Baseball Classic starts March 5.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: A $20M penthouse at Ocean House, Westerly, Rhode Island, includes a private terrace and panoramic ocean views.
The luxury unit, created by merging two condo units, features three bedrooms, four bathrooms, and two living rooms.
Penthouse ownership includes Ocean House Club access, providing amenities like a gym, spa, and private beach.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Boston Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference with a 35-19 record entering the All-Star break.
Jaylen Brown averages 29.3 points per game, helping Celtics achieve top offensive and defensive ratings.
Celtics struggle in clutch situations, ranking 21st in the league with a 12-14 record in close games.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers winter attractions including museums, beaches, restaurants, and breweries across its 15 towns.
Notable museums include Sandwich Glass Museum, JFK Hyannis Museum, Cape Cod Museum of Art, and Wydah Pirate Museum.
Winter activities feature hiking trails, cross-country skiing, and snowshoeing at locations like Cape Cod Rail Trail and Nickerson State Park.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski, from Fuquay-Varina, diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Breakthrough T1D.
Having lived in Boston during her pharmacy school years, Lapczynski aims to inspire others with Type 1 Diabetes through her marathon run.
Lapczynski's personal connection deepened when her mother was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes before her 70th birthday.

title: She picked up running at age 45. Now at 61, she’s on track for her Six Star medal.
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Andrea Nwamarah, 61, began running at age 45 through a YMCA 'Walk to Run' class.
Nwamarah is participating in the Boston Marathon to earn her Sixth Star medal.
She is running for the MEB Foundation, promoting healthy lifestyles and leadership among youth.
